text: Haxton Place holds an enduring and distinctive place in Salt Lake City's legacy. You'll be carried away to another time and place as you pass through the sandstone archways at the corner of South Temple and Haxton Place. The picturesque cul-de-sac is lined with stately homes and a canopy of mature trees, reminiscent of a prestigious English enclave. In 1909, the street was touted as One of the most handsome and exclusive residence sections in the city in Goodwin's Weekly Newspaper. The homes were described as Graceful expressions of utility by the Salt Lake Herald Republican in October of 1909. While it's been more than a century since these statements were printed, they still hold true. The ivy-covered estate holding court at the far end of the lane is 35 Haxton Place. 35 Haxton Place on the east side and 34 Haxton Place on the west side. Each of these properties are currently available for sale. Built in 1907 for members of the city's high society, these halls exude an air of historical significance. Many elements of the original craftsmanship continue to shine, such as the grand staircase and exposed beam ceilings, validating its place on the National Historic Register. The current owners have gone to great lengths to accurately restore the home to its proper state of grandeur. They carefully researched the home's provenance before refurbishing original elements such as the light fixtures and woodwork. Many practical modern updates have been made in recent years as well, such as the well-appointed kitchen that glows with natural light. Newly completed professional landscaping of the side yard aligns perfectly with the home's historic character and provides the perfect setting for garden parties. A greenhouse is attached to the lower level of the home for year-round gardening and a two-car garage can be accessed through an alley. Surrounded by historic homes and an immaculate garden, you will likely forget that you're just a stone's throw from downtown. Salt Lake City's finest restaurants and cultural institutions are minutes away. A quick drive up South Temple will take you to the University of Utah. This property is a treasured piece of Salt Lake City's history, a testament to the enduring power of quality craftsmanship. It also holds the promise of a bright future, with many more stories to write.
neighborhoods: South Temple Historic District, Central Salt Lake City, East Central

text: Thistle Creek Ranch Private Mountain Estate with Off-Grid Features and Recreational Appeal, Serene creek running through property Discover Thistle Creek Ranch, a serene mountain retreat just minutes from the heart of Utah County. Nestled off Highway 89 near Spanish Fork Canyon, this gated property offers the perfect balance of seclusion and accessibility-only 18 minutes from I-15, Costco, other stores, so close yet feels remote when you are out here. The home is ideal for family retreats, large gatherings, or even weddings, with office spaces, a craft room, a dorm-style room for guests or kids, and a full lower-level apartment with a second kitchen and wood-burning stove. Built with self-sufficiency in mind, the home includes 78 roof-mounted solar panels for electricity, 12 thermal panels for winter heat, and a 2, 000-gallon propane capacity. Thistle Creek Ranch has permanent rights to up to 12 acre-feet of water from the Spanish Fork City main line, delivering year-round spring water-filtered but untreated for those desiring chemical-free water. Additional infrastructure includes a large food storage room, reliable grid power, and high-speed internet. The 40' x 60' post-and-beam barn is solar-powered and ideal for horses, recreation, parties or events. A separate outbuilding serves as a heated gym and tack shed. The property spans varied terrain from 5, 100 to over 6, 200 feet in elevation. Thistle Creek meanders through the lower meadows, feeding a picturesque pond. Fenced pastures and irrigated paddocks surround the main compound, while the upper ranch features dramatic rock cliffs, meadows, and wooded trails. A secluded shooting range and plentiful wildlife-including elk, deer, and wild turkey-make this a hunter's paradise. Thistle Creek is known for its brown trout, and the ranch participates in the Utah DWR walk-in access program for seasonal rainbow trout fishing. Additional recreational opportunities include horseback riding, mountain biking, hiking, and camping, with potential sites for yurts or family campgrounds on the upper property. Previously used as both a private ranch and a residential treatment center, Thistle Creek Ranch is uniquely suited for personal or commercial use. Included Parcels: 65:022:0003 65:022:0001

text: Own a piece of the past located in historic downtown Lewiston, Utah! Built in 1924, this significant structure, once the site of the original Lewiston State Bank, has monumental potential for a future home owner, investor, business owner, or landlord. This impressive red brick and precast stone structure is located on the corner of Center and Main in Lewiston, giving it a downtown feeling in one of Cache Valley's most charming rural towns. The former bank has been vacant for several decades and needs some TLC, but it has some recent structural updates including: new windows, new sheeting on the second floor, reinforced structural beams for the second floor and roof, and new membrane roof. It is currently zoned commercial, however, the Lewiston City Council and Planning and Zoning have expressed willingness to accommodate owner's interested in mixed use, single family, or multi-family housing. Though it is not currently on the Historic Registry, funding for renovations through the Registry may be available. The building comes with 1.5 official parking stalls in back, though 2 cars will likely fit as well as daytime street parking on the west and north sides. Lewiston has also offered the potential of a long term lease of additional spots for multiple tenants, guests, employees, or customers. The building currently has a water meter on the property but will need to be connected along with power, natural gas, and sewer. Original blueprints and proposed single family floor plans included in the listing photos.
